box.text:
Welcome to iASSESS!

Click START!when you're ready.

For each question, select the answer before your time runs out!

question.text: Which of the following items does not belong in the 5S system?

box.text:
Correct!

The 5S system is composed of Sort, Set in Order, Shine, Standardize, and Sustain.

No!

The 5S system is composed of Sort, Set in Order, Shine, Standardize, and Sustain.

question.text: What do you call to that setup utility where you configure the “Boot Priority Settings” where you can select the disk that contains the Operating System?

box.text:
Correct!

BIOS is a special computer software or setup utility where you can select the disk that contains an Operating System. BIOS is an acronym for “Basic Input / Output System”

No!

BIOS is a special computer software or setup utility where you can select the disk that contains an Operating System. BIOS is an acronym for “Basic Input / Output System”

question.text: What should be done if the display does not match what you expect to view on the monitor?

option.text: Check if the video / graphics driver is working properly

box.text:
Correct!

Graphics Card driver or Video driver is the one responsible for the graphics, and everything you see on a display device like a monitor.

No!

Graphics Card driver or Video driver is the one responsible for the graphics, and everything you see on a display device like a monitor.

question.text: Which part of the computer system is also called “the brain or heart of the computer”?

box.text:
Correct!

Central Processing Unit (CPU) is the one responsible for all the processing required for the computer system to operate. It is aliased as the heart or brain of the computer system because aside from processing data, the CPU is also responsible for exchanging data between the system’s memory, peripherals and other components.

No!

Central Processing Unit (CPU) is the one responsible for all the processing required for the computer system to operate. It is aliased as the heart or brain of the computer system because aside from processing data, the CPU is also responsible for exchanging data between the system’s memory, peripherals and other components.

question.text: What should you do after installing peripheral devices such as sound card?

option.text: Install sound card device driver

box.text:
Correct!

In order to utilize a peripheral device, a device driver is required in the software side. Without it, peripherals are just a piece of metal and plastic because device drivers are the instructions written by the manufacturer for the operating system to harness the capability of the peripheral. In case you do not know, a sound card converts digital data to analog sound waves you can hear.

No!

In order to utilize a peripheral device, a device driver is required in the software side. Without it, peripherals are just a piece of metal and plastic because device drivers are the instructions written by the manufacturer for the operating system to harness the capability of the peripheral. In case you do not know, a sound card converts digital data to analog sound waves you can hear.

question.text: What should you wear to protect computer parts form ESD (Electrostatic Discharge)?

box.text:
Correct!

An anti-static wrist strap is a key piece of safety gear that helps to prevent the buildup of static electricity near sensitive electronics or other projects.

No!

An anti-static wrist strap is a key piece of safety gear that helps to prevent the buildup of static electricity near sensitive electronics or other projects.

question.text: What kind of cable are you going to use if you want to network two computer units only?

box.text:
Correct!

An Ethernet crossover cable, also known as a crossed cable, connects two Ethernet network devices to each other.

No!

An Ethernet crossover cable, also known as a crossed cable, connects two Ethernet network devices to each other.

question.text: What type of network would you suggest to your client who wants to network more than 100 computers?

box.text:
Correct!

Client/server network. A computer network in which one centralized, powerful computer (called the server) is a hub to which many less powerful personal computers or workstations (called clients) are connected. This type of network is perfectly fit for high number of computers.

No!

Client/server network. A computer network in which one centralized, powerful computer (called the server) is a hub to which many less powerful personal computers or workstations (called clients) are connected. This type of network is perfectly fit for high number of computers.

question.text: What type of network would you recommend if your client has only few computer units?

box.text:
Correct!

Stands for "Peer to Peer." In a P2P network, the "peers" are computer systems which are connected to each other via the Internet. It is good for low number of computer because each computer might be being accessed by others it can slow down the performance for the user.

No!

Stands for "Peer to Peer." In a P2P network, the "peers" are computer systems which are connected to each other via the Internet. It is good for low number of computer because each computer might be being accessed by others it can slow down the performance for the user.

question.text: What is the common type of cabling standards used for straight thru cable?

box.text:
Correct!

568B wiring standards is both end of straight thru cable, because it will be crossover cable If you use 568A wiring standards to the other end of your cable.

No!

568B wiring standards is both end of straight thru cable, because it will be crossover cable If you use 568A wiring standards to the other end of your cable.

question.text: What is the set-up where each computer acts as client and server and each user shares other’s file and data, including printers?

box.text:
Correct!

A client/server set-up is a system where one or more computers called clients connect to a central computer named a server to share or use resources.

No!

A client/server set-up is a system where one or more computers called clients connect to a central computer named a server to share or use resources.

question.text: What command you should use if you want to see your computer IP address?

box.text:
Correct!

The IP address is a numerical label that is used in networks to identify and locate network devices. IP address can be a useful piece of information, especially when you want to set up your home router or when you want to connect to other devices on a network.

No!

The IP address is a numerical label that is used in networks to identify and locate network devices. IP address can be a useful piece of information, especially when you want to set up your home router or when you want to connect to other devices on a network.

question.text: What special group contains all authenticated users and domain guest

box.text:
Correct!

Windows Server 2008 uses special identity groups to represent a class of users or the system itself. The everyone group is a special identity group that contains all authenticated users and domain guests.

No!

Windows Server 2008 uses special identity groups to represent a class of users or the system itself. The everyone group is a special identity group that contains all authenticated users and domain guests.

question.text: Aside from installing anti-virus software, how can you protect your server from viruses?

box.text:
Correct!

Firewall is a part of a computer system or network which is designed to block unauthorized access or viruses while permitting outward communication.

No!

Firewall is a part of a computer system or network which is designed to block unauthorized access or viruses while permitting outward communication.

question.text: What are you going to do to access a server located far from the client computer which you are troubleshooting?

box.text:
Correct!

Remote Desktop Connection is one of the components of Microsoft Windows that allow a user to take control of a remote computer or virtual machine over a network connection.

No!

Remote Desktop Connection is one of the components of Microsoft Windows that allow a user to take control of a remote computer or virtual machine over a network connection.

question.text: What would you advise to a client who wants to upgrade their computer’s built-in video card?

option.text: Buy a new video card with higher capacity
Buy a new memory card with lower capacity
Buy a video card with lower capacity

box.text:
Correct!

If you want to upgrade your computer’s built-in video card, you should buy a new video card with higher capacity to make your computer faster.

No!

If you want to upgrade your computer’s built-in video card, you should buy a new video card with higher capacity to make your computer faster.

question.text: What should you do if your computer does not recognize your bootable flash drive?

option.text: Configure your BIOS to boot on the optical disk drive
Configure your BIOS to boot on the hard drive
Configure your BIOS to boot on the flash drive

box.text:
Correct!

When the computer starts, the system BIOS begins to check a pre-determined list of drives and devices that may contain an operating system such as Windows and if your flash drive doesn’t recognize by the computer you need to boot your BIOS to the flash drive.

No!

When the computer starts, the system BIOS begins to check a pre-determined list of drives and devices that may contain an operating system such as Windows and if your flash drive doesn’t recognize by the computer you need to boot your BIOS to the flash drive.

question.text: If your brand-new computer does not display any image or character, what is the first step you must take?

option.text: Check the cable of your monitor
Check your power supply cable

box.text:
Correct!

The first step you must take is check your cable of your monitor because it might be loose and your monitor doesn’t gain any power from your power supply.

No!

The first step you must take is check your cable of your monitor because it might be loose and your monitor doesn’t gain any power from your power supply.

question.text: Which storage device can store high amount of data?

box.text:
Correct!

>Hard Disk Drive (HDD) has a capacity of 250 GB to 1 terabyte or 1000 GB.

No!

Hard Disk Drive (HDD) has a capacity of 250 GB to 1 terabyte or 1000 GB.

question.text: Which of the following choices, where you can change the date and time of your computer?

box.text:
Correct!

CMOS (complementary metal-oxide-semiconductor) is the term usually used to describe the small amount of memory on a computer motherboard that stores the BIOS settings. If the CMOS battery is failing, the computer cannot keep the correct time or date on the computer after it has been turned off.

No!

CMOS (complementary metal-oxide-semiconductor) is the term usually used to describe the small amount of memory on a computer motherboard that stores the BIOS settings. If the CMOS battery is failing, the computer cannot keep the correct time or date on the computer after it has been turned off.

question.text: What is a networking device that can access information over a mobile wireless network?

box.text:
Correct!

Wireless Application Protocol (WAP) is a technical standard for accessing information over a mobile wireless network. WAPs feature radio transmitters and antennae, which facilitate connectivity between devices and the Internet or a network.

No!

Wireless Application Protocol (WAP) is a technical standard for accessing information over a mobile wireless network. WAPs feature radio transmitters and antennae, which facilitate connectivity between devices and the Internet or a network.

question.text: What is a networking device that analyzes the contents of data packets transmitted within a network or to another network using cable?

box.text:
Correct!

A router is a networking device that forwards data packets between computer networks. Routers perform the traffic directing functions on the Internet. The main purpose of a router is to connect multiple networks and forward packets destined either for its own networks or other networks.

No!

A router is a networking device that forwards data packets between computer networks. Routers perform the traffic directing functions on the Internet. The main purpose of a router is to connect multiple networks and forward packets destined either for its own networks or other networks.

question.text: What is a networking device that passes on anything received on one connection to all other connections?

box.text:
Correct!

The purpose of a hub is to join multiple computers or other network devices together to form a single network segment. On this network segment, all devices can communicate directly with each other.

No!

The purpose of a hub is to join multiple computers or other network devices together to form a single network segment. On this network segment, all devices can communicate directly with each other.

question.text: What is a networking device that connects a number of computers together to make a LAN?

box.text:
Correct!

A Network Switch is a constituent of computer network that connects two network slices and/or two network devices together.

No!

A Network Switch is a constituent of computer network that connects two network slices and/or two network devices together.

question.text: What first step you must take if you accidentally spilled a water in your computer which you are currently using.

option.text: Wipe place where you spilled the water

box.text:
Correct!

The first step you must take is unplugged you power cable to avoid short circuit.
No!
Times up!
